intro: Pedicularis canadensis var. gladiata, commonly known as the Canadian beardtongue, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its spurred petals and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats such as streambanks and meadows. It produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
